title: Lodestar-besu error - BLOCK_ERROR_EXECUTION_PAYLOAD_NOT_VALID
body:
### Description
There's an error in lodestar-besu issue in `137.184.106.25` node as tracked in https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/issues/3388

The block `0x19f2b43ef5572883499a7560f68ed718ce7095bc83d3b1fee3e425ce9b93e191` was assumed to be imported successfully, however it's not found later

```
devops@pithos-lodestar-besu-1 ➜  ~ docker logs a1454e465b6c | grep 0x19f2b43ef5572883499a7560f68ed718ce7095bc83d3b1fee3e425ce9b93e191 | head -n 10
SLF4J: Class path contains multiple SLF4J bindings.
SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/opt/besu/lib/log4j-slf4j-impl-2.14.1.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
SLF4J: Found binding in [jar:file:/opt/besu/lib/logback-classic-1.2.3.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
SLF4J: See http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#multiple_bindings for an explanation.
SLF4J: Actual binding is of type [org.apache.logging.slf4j.Log4jLoggerFactory]
2021-10-22 23:13:30.660+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | INFO  | EngineForkchoiceUpdated | Consensus fork-choice-update: head: 0x19f2b43ef5572883499a7560f68ed718ce7095bc83d3b1fee3e425ce9b93e191, finalized: 0x926181c832f182f7b0442ee9f26e40824e644167c71fb16b793cf62e41c63940
2021-10-22 23:13:39.685+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-0 | ERROR | MainnetBlockValidator | Attempted to import block 52223 with hash 0x6d5744a9f813f81bdd90e517c85bc4e273e758eda93cbdcca525a91d684cc518 but parent block 0x19f2b43ef5572883499a7560f68ed718ce7095bc83d3b1fee3e425ce9b93e191 was not present

```

### Acceptance Criteria
* Should be able to import block `0x6d5744a9f813f81bdd90e517c85bc4e273e758eda93cbdcca525a91d684cc518` if it's parent is imported successfully

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
Not sure if this issue is reproducable, perhaps the best way is to look into the log
1. Launch lodestar-besu in Pithos testnet

**Expected behavior:** The node stays synced

**Actual behavior:** Get stuck at consensus block 60941 (execution block 52222)

**Frequency:** Not sure as it's the only instance in Pithos testnet

### Versions (Add all that apply)

### Additional Information
Check more in `137.184.106.25` machine

Separately this morning,  I noticed that the besu-lodestar combo was not healthy and presumed it was due to besu not yet having [backwards sync](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/2912) implemented.   

The logs do imply that the parent block should be present, but the besu image that is running is not logging any consensus endpoints other than fork-choice-updated.  It isn't clear why we would successfully set the head, but then fail to find the block.  Presumably backwards-sync would remedy this if it were to occur, but it isn't clear how we got into this state to begin with.

FYI, after re-syncing lodestar and replaying all of the payloads, the lodestar-besu combo is healthy again.  I will continue to monitor while I am investigating this issue.
